text: Eliphalet S. Miner was a member of the Wisconsin State Assembly and the Wisconsin State Senate. ==Biography== Miner was born on March 20, 1818 in Madison, New York. He settled in what is now Grand Rapids, Wisconsin in 1841 before moving to Necedah, Wisconsin in 1850. There, he went into the lumber business with John T. Kingston. Miner died on February 9, 1890. ==Political career== Miner was a member of the Assembly from 1865 to 1866. In the Senate, he represented the 9th District in 1871 and the 29th District in 1872. Other positions he held include Postmaster of Grand Rapids, Postmaster of Necedah, and justice of the peace. A Republican, Miner was affiliated with the National Union Party while he was in the Assembly. ==References== Category:People from Madison, New York Category:People from Necedah, Wisconsin Category:Wisconsin state senators Category:Members of the Wisconsin State Assembly Category:American postmasters Category:American justices of the peace Category:Wisconsin Republicans Category:1818 births Category:1890 deaths Category:People from Grand Rapids, Wisconsin Category:19th-century American politicians
title: Eliphalet S. Miner
